Hiérachisation des risques professionnels is ''obligatoire'' in companies and ''under the responsibility of the employer'', but the multidisciplinary occupational health team and the occupational physician must contribute to it.

===3 steps===

====1.      Hazard identification and characterisation:====

*knowledge of workstations
*knowledge of product composition (safety data sheets)

====2.      Exposure assessment:====

*ambient and individual measurements: e.g. noise metrology
*measurements of biological indicators of exposure (toxins or metabolites measured in the biological media of exposed subjects).
*ergonomic studies of workstations

====3.      Estimated risks:====

*Comparison of measured exposures with exposure limit values that must not be exceeded to protect health.
*Limit values: based on dose-response relationships published in the literature, exist for a large number of dangerous chemical agents, asbestos, noise and ionising radiation....


Must be followed by a ''prevention plan'' formalising the ''risk management approach''.

question.title: What is the correct order of the 3 steps of the risk assessment process in occupational medicine?
question.description: The risk assessment process in occupational medicine consists of three steps: hazard identification and characterisation, exposure assessment, and estimated risks. What is the correct order of these steps?

option_a.title: Hazard identification and characterisation, exposure assessment, estimated risks
option_a.description: A common order of the risk assessment process, but not the correct one

option_b.title: Estimated risks, hazard identification and characterisation, exposure assessment
option_b.description: A plausible but incorrect order of the risk assessment process

option_c.title: Exposure assessment, hazard identification and characterisation, estimated risks
option_c.description: The correct order of the risk assessment process in occupational medicine

option_d.title: Estimated risks, exposure assessment, hazard identification and characterisation
option_d.description: An incorrect order of the risk assessment process, but not as clear as option B
